name: Riverside Hotel Killarney

reviews.text: Hotel needs slight renovation and updating however staff were the most friendly and helpful you could wish for. Food was excellent and plenty of it the bed was the most comfortable that we have slept in for many a year, town was close by with numerous restaurants and shops all in all a great stay
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on bed and breakfast and evening dinner.First the pros. hotel is only 10 to 15 minutes walk from town or around 5euro for taxi.
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.text: Lobby is very spacious with lots of comfortable seating. Reception staff are efficient with a speedy check in. Room was a nice size not overly spacious but ok beds were large and comfortable. Meals Breakfast was excellent (I prefer the full irish which was just lovely) all the healthy options were available as you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Dining room staff were friendly and couldn't do enough for you.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Now for the cons. Shower is over the bath and stepping out of the bath is just a little bit iffy as we are no spring chickens. The bar is nice but is set up for eating so its not overly comfortable and could do with a makeover. Overall we had a lovely time and would not hesitate to return again.
reviews.title: Riverside Killarney could use room updates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well positioned within easy walking distance from killarney town centre. The hotel is a bit dated especially rooms and restaurant area. Very average food served for breakfast and dinner but the mangeress Victoria and the lady at reception Marianne VERY HELPFUL and efficient could not do enough for us. Thank You both.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Riverside Hotel in Killarney. It was a lovely relaxing & enjoyable stay. We got a beautiful room & it was very spacious, comfortable & quiet.The free wi-fi was also great. The staff were exceptionally nice & were very helpful at all times. I cannot praise them enough. The food was lovely, we enjoyed a really tasty lunch. Food selection was really good too. Overall a great stay, thoroughly enjoyed it. Would like to add that there was parking always available & hotel is very near Killarney town centre. It s definitely worth a visit & we will be going back again to visit.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, great location

reviews.text: this hotel is a good value, but it is a bit of a hike to town. breakfast was so-so, but that could be because i was with a large group and we did not get a choice of the hot entrees. the bar however was good with good service and prices. it was also open late. the hotel lounge was large and well appointed.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on Business. The hotel is really worth it's 4 stars.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location. Well worth a visit!!

reviews.text: The rooms are of a high spec, clean and comfortable. The reception staff were very nice and accommodating. The food was really nice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.text: The only negative point, the bar was under staffed and the staff that were there were under a little bit of pressure.
reviews.title: Deserves the 2013 award it received and more

reviews.text: Had a great experience here. Staff was very friendly and the hotel was fab. Rooms were lovely and clean, just what you expect and as other reviewers have said, I found the bed very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and I only wish I had had the time to experience the spa. Will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Hotel meets 4-star expectations in terms of room & amenities... bed was very comfortable, (with greater sleep quality than the 5 star hotel we stayed at in Dublin earlier)
reviews.title: Serivce beyond 4-star

reviews.text: Service staff especially at the front desk were exceptional. There were 2 ladies (unfortunately I cannot remember their names but they worked the morning shift on Aug 10 & 11) who were most obliging and helpful even when we wanted to move shortly after checking in , when we felt it may be noisy as the rooms face carparks and are without air-conditioning. They helped check for alternative hotels - as it was the peak season, several hotels were full , so we stayed. Stay turned out to be fine
reviews.title: My experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can honestly say that I really love staying in the Riverside in Killarney, it is so near the town and an excuse to walk in and out of the town. The staff are very friendly and helful..The breakfasts are lovely but there could be more choice. Meals are lovely.. The only disadvantage about the hotel is that their is no leisure centre and I think that is what it really needs it. I am looking forward to another trip to the Riverside in the Autumn. Claire
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: We stayed for an overnight at the last minute and were very surprised at the standard and quality of the location and the professionalism of the staff, upon arrival the lobby was welcoming and the receptionist was most helpful and courteous.The room was tastefully decorated and the bed was comfortable and clean. The room was of a good standard throughout. Breakfast was very tasty with table service and a good selection of buffet cereals and juices, asking the server for a Gluten free breakfast was no problem and they even had gluten free bread. Overall this hotel was a good experience and I would recommend it to friends and I definitely would stay there again
reviews.title: Perfect for a Weekend in Killarney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed four days in the Riverside Hotel this week and we were delighted with the warm welcome we received. Some staff merit a special thank you for making our visit to Killarney so memorable. Muireann at Reception was always so pleasant and helpful and created an excellent first impression - so very important . Victoria was a great addition in the dining room and bar and was ably assisted by the ever courteous Christy . He epitomises all that is best in Irish hospitality. We miss him!
reviews.title: Irish hospitality at its best

reviews.text: Breakfasts were very good and dinners were so good that we dined in the Riverside every night even though I had a list of tempting restaurants in the town of a Killarney. Try the tempura prawns and the chocolate pudding!
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and very comfortable with a six foot bed and crisp linen plus a spacious bathroom were all that you could ask for. We had a room facing the road but were not aware of noise unless you would find the clip clop of the horses' hooves a distraction. I found it very restful and pleasing.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fee Wifi was an added bonus although having to renew the code every 12 hours might seem tedious to some! It's true you can't please everybody all the time but I think some of the negative comments from other reviewers were just unwarranted.
reviews.title: corkmum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night here. The rooms are dated. I was surprised by this. Staff Are nice.
reviews.title: very friendly

description: A modern contemporary interior with tasteful furnishings, giving a warm relaxed atmosphere; the perfect Business Retreat.
